original: Berne, Otto Konrad, distriktslantmätare, kapten, Göteborg, f. 1/6/91 i Ekeby s:n, Malmöh. 1. G. 20 m. Majken Hildebrand. Barn: Ulf-Gunnar f. 21. — Stud:ex. 10, res :off :ex. 15, lantmät:ex. 17, kulturtekn. ex. 23. Kapt. i 1. 6 res. 31. Distr :lantmät. i Jämtl il. 31-39, bitr. öv :ilantmät. i Kopparb. 1. 39-41, distr :lantmät. i Gbgs s. dirstr. sed. 41. RVOlkl.
translated: Berne, Otto Konrad, district surveyor, captain, from Gothenburg, born on June 1st, 1891 in Ekeby Parish, Malmöhus County. Married for the first time in 1920 to Majken Hildebrand, with whom he had one child, Ulf-Gunnar, born in 1921. He passed his student exam in 1910, completed his reserve officer exam in 1915, his surveyor exam in 1917, and his agricultural engineering exam in 1923. He became a captain in the 1st 6th reserve in 1931. He served as a district surveyor in Jämtland County from 1931 to 1939, and as an assistant county surveyor in Kopparberg County from 1939 to 1941, after which he served as a district surveyor in Gothenburg until his retirement in 1941. He was awarded the Order of the Polar Star.
